tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.
This may refer to a style of music.

tn.ref: whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered
tn.text: These phrases have similar meanings. They can be stated in active form. AT: "who God forgives his transgression and covers his sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Here sin that is forgiven is spoken of as if it were covered so that it can not be seen. AT: "whose sin is ignored" or "whose sin is deliberately forgotten" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: to whom Yahweh reckons no guilt
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Yahweh sees as innocent" or "who is not guilty according to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: in whose spirit there is no deceit
tn.text: Here "spirit" refers to the person. AT: "in whom there is not deceit" or "who is completely honest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "my bones" refers to the writer. AT: "I was wasting away" or "I was getting weaker" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This idiom means "continually." AT: "all the time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These extremes include everything in between. AT: "all the time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: your hand was heavy upon me
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to Yahweh. The entire phrase is an idiom that means "you afflicted me." AT: "you made me suffer greatly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: My strength withered as in summer drought
tn.text: David's strength is compared to a small, green plant that turns brown and crumbles in the dry season. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

This may be a musical term that tells people how to sing or play their instruments here. Some translations write the Hebrew word, and some translations do not include it. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:003:001|3:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_transliterate]])

This may be a musical term that tells people how to sing or play their instruments here. Some translations write the Hebrew word, and some translations do not include it. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:003:001|3:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_transliterate]])

tn.ref: at a time of great distress
tn.text: "when they are in great trouble."

tn.ref: Then when the surging waters overflow, they will not reach those people
tn.text: Difficulties are spoken of as if they were a flood of water. AT: "Then when difficulties come like a flood of water, those people will be safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Yahweh is spoken of as if he was a safe place from the attacks of the writer's enemies. AT: "You are like a place where I can hide myself from my enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: You will surround me with the songs of victory
tn.text: This metaphor apparently means that Yahweh's protection of the writer is the cause for songs of victory to be sung. AT: "Because of you I will sing songs of victory" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

This may be a musical term that tells people how to sing or play their instruments here. Some translations write the Hebrew word, and some translations do not include it. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:003:001|3:2]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_transliterate]])

tn.ref: I will instruct you and teach you in the way
tn.text: The words "instruct" and "teach" mean basically the same thing and emphasize careful instruction. AT: "I will teach you everything about the way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Here the "I" is probably Yahweh who talks directly to David.

tn.ref: in the way which you should go
tn.text: Living in the correct way is spoken of as if it were a path that the writer should walk. AT: "how you should live your life"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "my eye" refers to Yahweh's attention. AT: "and direct my attention to you" or "and watch over you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Do not be like a horse ... no understanding
tn.text: The writer compares people with no understanding to horses and mules. Possible meanings are 1) the writer is speaking Yahweh's words to his readers, "You all must not be like a horse ... no understanding" or 2) Yahweh is speaking to the writer as though to a group of people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Two tools that are used by people to guide horses and mules go where the rider wants them to go.
"where anyone wants them to go." The "you" here is singular and refers to no one in particular.
Yahweh's faithfulness that will "surround" him causes protection and guidance. AT: "will guide" or "will protect"
Here "in Yahweh" refers to what Yahweh has done for them. "Be glad because of what Yahweh has done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This refers to people. AT: "you righteous people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
"shout joyfully" or "shout because of joy"
Here "heart" refers to the person. AT: "people who are upright" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
